tit.e: Shiokumi-toge Pass (a pass on the border of Maizuru City and Takahama Town)
Shiokumi-toge Pass (a pass on the border of Maizuru City and Takahama Town)

sen.j: 塩汲峠（しおくみとうげ）は日本の福井県大飯郡高浜町と京都府舞鶴市を隔てる峠である。
sen.e: Shiokumi-toge Pass is a pass that forms a border between Maizuru City (Kyoto Prefecture) and Takahama-cho (Oi-gun, Fukui Prefecture).
Shiokumi-toge Pass is a pass separates Maizuru City (Kyoto Prefecture) and Takahama Town (Oi-gun County, Fukui Prefecture).
Shiokumi-toge Pass is a pass separates Maizuru City (Kyoto Prefecture) and Takahama Town (Oi County, Fukui Prefecture).

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 福井県道・京都府道772号高浜舞鶴線上にある標高154mの峠である。
sen.e: It is 154m above sea level and it is on Fukui Prefectural Road/Takahama-Maizuru-sen Kyoto Prefectural Road 772.
It is the pass located on Fukui Prefectural Road and Kyoto Prefectural Road 772 Takahama-Maizuru Line at an altitude of 154 meters.
It is the pass located on Fukui Prefectural Road and Kyoto Prefectural Road 772 Takahama-Maizuru Line at an altitude of 154 meters.

sen.j: 福井県の最西端に位置し、吉坂峠と共に若狭の自然の要塞として機能してきた歴史がある。
sen.e: It is the westernmost of Fukui Prefecture and for a long time it had served as a natural fortress in Wakasa area (Fukui Prefecture) as well as Kissaka-toge Pass.
It is the westernmost of Fukui Prefecture and for a long time it had served as a natural fortress in Wakasa area as well as Kissaka-toge Pass.
It is the westernmost of Fukui Prefecture and for a long time it had served as a natural fortress in Wakasa area as well as Kissaka-toge Pass.

sen.j: 名前の由来は古代からこの付近は製塩業が盛んであり、海水を汲み上げて乾燥させ塩を作り、それを京都まで運んでいた為。
sen.e: Its name 'Shiokumi (scooping salt)' originates from manufacture of fine salt around the foot of the pass; since ancient times the people had scooped ('kumi') seawater, made fine salt ('shio') by drying the seawater, and carried it to Kyoto (an inland city) through the pass.

Its name 'Shiokumi' (scooping salt) originates from manufacture of fine salt around the foot of the pass; since ancient times the people had scooped ('kumi' in Japanese) seawater, made fine salt ('shio' in Japanese) by drying the seawater, and carried it to central Kyoto through the pass.

Its name 'Shiokumi' (scooping salt) originates from manufacture of fine salt around the foot of the pass; since ancient times the people had scooped ('kumi' in Japanese) seawater, made fine salt ('shio' in Japanese) by drying the seawater, and carried it to central Kyoto through the pass.

sen.j: 現在でも県境の峠として知名度が高く、また京都側からの内浦湾 (福井県)の景観が大変美しくサイクリングロードとしても有名な峠である。
sen.e: It is still famous as a border between two prefectures, besides, for the fantastic view of Uchiura-wan Bay (Fukui Prefecture) from Kyoto side of the pass, it is popular as an ideal cycling road too.
It is still famous as a border between two prefectures, besides, for the fantastic view of Uchiura-wan Bay (Fukui Prefecture) from Kyoto side of the pass, it is popular as an ideal cycling road too.
It is still famous as a border between two prefectures, besides, for the fantastic view of Uchiura-wan Bay (Fukui Prefecture) from Kyoto side of the pass, it is popular as an ideal cycling road too.

sen.j: また福井県道・京都府道772号は福井県側に峠を越えてすぐ、京都府道・福井県道21号舞鶴野原港高浜線と重複し、福井県内で福井県道・京都府道772号の単独区間を走れる数少ないスポットともなっている。
sen.e: Since 'Fukui Prefectural Road/Kyoto Prefectural Road 772' becomes 'Kyoto Prefectural Road/Maizuru-Noharakou-Takahama-sen Fukui Prefectural Road 21' right at the foot of Fukui side of the pass, 'Fukui Prefectural Road/Kyoto Prefectural Road 772' is quite short in Fukui Prefecture (only the section on the pass).

Since Fukui Prefectural Road and Kyoto Prefectural Road 772 becomes Kyoto Prefectural Road and Fukui Prefectural Road 21 Maizuru-Noharako-Takahama Line right at the foot of Fukui Prefecture side of the pass, Fukui Prefectural Road and Kyoto Prefectural Road 772 is quite short in Fukui Prefecture (only the section on the pass).

Since Fukui Prefectural Road and Kyoto Prefectural Road 772 becomes Kyoto Prefectural Road and Fukui Prefectural Road 21 Maizuru-Noharako-Takahama Line right at the foot of Fukui Prefecture side of the pass, Fukui Prefectural Road and Kyoto Prefectural Road 772 is quite short in Fukui Prefecture (only the section on the pass).

sen.j: 峠の標高が低いこともあり、福井県京都府の両側ともすぐ近くに集落があり、あまり峠らしい様相は呈していない。
sen.e: As its altitude is low and there are villages near the pass both on Fukui Prefecture side and on Kyoto Prefecture side, it doesn't look like a normal pass of country hill.
As its altitude is low and there are villages near the pass both on Fukui Prefecture side and on Kyoto Prefecture side, it doesn't look like a normal pass of country hill.
As its altitude is low and there are villages near the pass both on Fukui Prefecture side and on Kyoto Prefecture side, it doesn't look like a normal pass of country hill.

sen.j: 路面もアスファルトで舗装され、麓から峠まで片側1車線の確保された、4輪車でも安心して通行できる峠である。
sen.e: The road is two lanes wide and paved with asphalt from the foot to the peak, so four-wheeled vehicles can run through it easily and safely.
The road is two lanes wide and paved with asphalt from the foot to the peak, so four-wheeled vehicles can run through it easily and safely.
The road is two lanes wide and paved with asphalt from the foot to the peak, so four-wheeled vehicles can run through it easily and safely.

sen.j: ただし程よいワインディングロードであることと福井県側の景観が良いこともあり、サイクリングを楽しむ人が多く、自転車には注意が必要である。
sen.e: However, as there are many riders on bicycles enjoying the moderate winding road and the fine view from Fukui Prefecture side, car drivers have to be careful of them.
However, as there are many riders on bicycles enjoying the moderate winding road and the fine view from Fukui Prefecture side, car drivers have to be careful of them.
However, as there are many riders on bicycles enjoying the moderate winding road and the fine view from Fukui Prefecture side, car drivers have to be careful of them.

sen.j: 京都府道・福井県道21号舞鶴野原港高浜線（重複）
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Road/Maizuru-Noharkou-Takahama-sen Fukui Prefectural Road 21 ('Fukui Prefectural Road/Takahama-Maizuru-sen Kyoto Prefectural Road 772' change its name at the foot of Fukui Prefecture side of the pass.)
Kyoto Prefectural Road and Fukui Prefectural Road 21 Maizuru-Noharako-Takahama Line (duplicated)
Kyoto Prefectural Road and Fukui Prefectural Road 21 Maizuru-Noharako-Takahama Line (duplicated)
